field.name: description
field.value: {code}fun f(vararg t : Int, f : ()->Unit) {}fun test() { f(1) { } // OK f(1, 2) { } // Strange irrelevant message} {code}

field.name: summary
field.value: Bug is not updated by years

comment.author: Nikolay.Bukharev
comment.text: Sorry, kotlin is set by default for me..

field.name: description
field.value: if use java, it's work:!image.png!if use kotlin, not work:!image2.png!

field.name: description
field.value: {code}class C(val id: String) { fun foo(other: C) { if (id == other.<caret>) }}{code}There is no "id" in smart completion there.

field.name: description
field.value: If there are several files opened, variable declarations at namespace level are checked only in a one (the first in the lexicographical order). In others the contents is marked as 'not resolved to anything'.{code}namespace myval f : fun(Any) : Unit = { () : Unit => }fun foo() { val g : fun(Any) : Unit = { () : Unit => }}{code}

comment.author: develar
comment.text: delete it

field.name: summary
field.value: Soft modifier 'out' is not quite soft

comment.author: Andrey.Breslav
comment.text: Looks like a bug in the praser

field.name: summary
field.value: Usage of Kotlin generic method from Java wrongly highlighted in IDEA

field.name: description
field.value: Code compiles and works, but highlighted.```kotlinpackage bugtrait Aclass B : Afun foo<T : A>(a: T): T = a``````javaimport bug.B;import bug.BugPackage;public class JavaClass { public static void main(String[] args) { B b = BugPackage.foo(new B()); // << wrong error: "Incompatible types. Required: bug.B, Found: bug.A" }}```

comment.author: Andrey.Breslav
comment.text: Signatures in the bytecode look the same, javac does not complain. Looks like a problem either in ClsPsi or our wrappers

field.name: summary
field.value: is it bug in realese : Intent(this, SecondActivity::class.java) unresolved reference: java

comment.author: yole
comment.text:
No, it's not a bug. Most likely you have mismatched versions of your Kotlin plugin and runtime library.
If you are not sure whether something is a bug, please ask on our forums or in Slack before filing a YouTrack issue.

comment.author: kamenovnurlan
comment.text: thank YOU. it was as you wrote: mismatch versions

field.name: summary
field.value: Kotlin Bug using collections operations inside validation

field.name: description
field.value: I'm not sure if it's a bug, but i have never found this error.The attachment images explains the bug.I made a validation to check if a counter is less than 3, and inside the else block i made some operations with lists, and it gave this error.

comment.author: sashache
comment.text: Thanks, linked to existent issue.

field.name: summary
field.value: Kotlin - "No cast needed" when the cast is acutally needed

field.name: description
field.value: I have a following code:!image.png!The IDE says that the cast is not needed and provides an option to remove it, but the code without cast doesn't compile, as can be seen below.!image2.png!Code used to reproduce the bug:{code:lang=kotlin}open class Baseclass Derived : Base()class Bug{ lateinit var bug: Array<Array<Base>> fun bug() { bug = Array(1, { Array(1, { Derived() as Base }) }) }}{code}

comment.author: Alexey.Belkov

field.name: summary
field.value: JS: println(null) and println(object) doesn't work on node.js

field.name: description
field.value: {code}class Bean fun main(args : Array<String>) { println(Bean())}{code}Lead to error like this even if there is toString implementation:{code}net.js:614 throw new TypeError('invalid data'); ^TypeError: invalid data at Socket.write (net.js:614:11) at Kotlin.NodeJsOutput.Kotlin.createClassNow.print (/home/cy/IdeaProjects/bug/out/production/bug/tmp.js:751:23) at Kotlin.createClassNow.println (/home/cy/IdeaProjects/bug/out/production/bug/tmp.js:743:12) at Object.Kotlin.println (/home/cy/IdeaProjects/bug/out/production/bug/tmp.js:788:16) at Object.Kotlin.defineRootPackage.injectme.Kotlin.definePackage.main (/home/cy/IdeaProjects/bug/out/production/bug/tmp.js:19312:16) at /home/cy/IdeaProjects/bug/out/production/bug/tmp.js:19317:14 at Object.<anonymous> (/home/cy/IdeaProjects/bug/out/production/bug/tmp.js:19318:2) at Module._compile (module.js:456:26) at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:474:10) at Module.load (module.js:356:32){code}However I can print strings{code}println(Bean().toString()) {code}

field.name: summary
field.value: JS: TypeError when try to access to "simple" property (w/o backing field at runtime)

field.name: description
field.value: ```kotlinpackage bugopen class A { val foo: Int = 0 var bar: Int = 0}class B : A() { fun test() { super.foo super.bar super.bar = 2 } }fun main(args: Array<String>) { B().test()}```Generated code:```js(function (Kotlin) { 'use strict'; var _ = Kotlin.defineRootPackage(null, /** @lends _ */ { bug: Kotlin.definePackage(null, /** @lends _.bug */ { A: Kotlin.createClass(null, function () { this.foo = 0; this.bar = 0; }), B: Kotlin.createClass(function () { return [_.bug.A]; }, function $fun() { $fun.baseInitializer.call(this); }, /** @lends _.bug.B.prototype */ { test: function () { Kotlin.callGetter(this, _.bug.A, 'foo'); Kotlin.callGetter(this, _.bug.A, 'bar'); Kotlin.callSetter(this, _.bug.A, 'bar', 2); } }), main: function (args) { (new _.bug.B()).test(); } }) }); Kotlin.defineModule('js150505', _); _.bug.main([]);}(Kotlin));```Stack trace:```Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefinedKotlin.callGetter @ kotlin.js:193Kotlin.defineRootPackage.bug.Kotlin.definePackage.B.Kotlin.createClass.test @js150505.js:15Kotlin.defineRootPackage.bug.Kotlin.definePackage.main @ js150505.js:21(anonymous function) @ js150505.js:27(anonymous function) @ js150505.js:28```

comment.author: Zalim.Bashorov
comment.text: Related discussion: https://devnet.jetbrains.com/message/5541753

field.name: summary
field.value: Autocast data is incorrectly merged on ||

field.name: description
field.value: {code}// BUGfun set(key : String, value : String) { val a : Any? = "" if (a is String || a is Int) { a.compareTo("") // !!! } if (a is Int) { a.compareTo("") } when (a) { is String, is Any => a.compareTo("") // !!! }}{code}

field.name: description
field.value: //from EAto prevent a bug to developers 'Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError'

field.name: summary
field.value: Web site: get kotlin button isn't visible in Firefox

field.name: description
field.value: And that's it. One cannot use `Unit.VALUE` in Kotlin anymore.

comment.author: Andrey.Breslav
comment.text: Not a bug: use `Unit` instead

field.name: summary
field.value: Cannot implement a Java interface in a Kotlin enum (and should be able to!)

field.name: description
field.value: I have this Java interface (from a dependency which I cannot change)```package bug;public interface Bug { String name();}```In Java it is possible to implement the interface in an Enum```public enum BugEnum implements Bug { ONE}```In Kotlin, I cannot implement the interface in an enum```enum class BugEnum : Bug { ONE}```I get the following compile error:> Class 'ONE' must be declared abstract or implement abstract member public abstract fun name(): String! defined in bug.BugIf I explicitly implement the interface:```enum class BugEnum : Bug { ONE { override fun name(): String { throw UnsupportedOperationException("not implemented") } }}```I get the following errors:> Inherited platform declarations clash: The following declarations have the same JVM signature (name()Ljava/lang/String;):> fun <get-name>(): String> fun name(): String!> Accidental override: The following declarations have the same JVM signature (name()Ljava/lang/String;):> fun <get-name>(): String> fun name(): String

field.value: when light classes and light methods and even parameters in light annotations could be converted. It is obviously a bug

comment.author: yole
comment.text: This actually looks like a bug in the Markdown plugin, not in Kotlin

comment.text: Yes, it is a bug in markdown plugin. However we don't provide completion at this point so we can amend bug summary.

field.value: ``` kotlinclass A { class B class C init { // Error: Expecting 'constructor' keyword val x = 1 }}```

comment.author: goodwinnk
comment.text: Parse thinks 'init' is a modifier for primary constructor. Possible workarounds are ; or {} in the end of line with {monospace}class C{monospace}

field.name: summary
field.value: Bug in incremental compilation: module is not recompiled when optional parameter added

field.name: description
field.value: In one module:{code}class A { fun foo(s: String) { }}{code}In another module:{code}fun main(args: Array<String>) { A().foo("")}{code}Add optional parameter to A.foo(). And run main. NoSuchMethodError happens.

field.name: description
field.value: I've got the following code:{code}if (event?.typeName!="AlertAccepted") return lbval text=event.fields["58-text"]!!{code}Idea flags the second usage of "event" as potentially null, even though if it was null, the equallty check on the first line would have failed and the function would have returned.

field.name: summary
field.value: IDEA suggests removing the type argument in the case when it's impossible (due to the bug in FE?)

field.name: description
field.value: ```interface Aclass B : Afun test(l: List<Int>, a: A?) { val b: List<A> = l.mapTo(ArrayList<A>(12)) { a ?: B() }}```

field.name: summary
field.value: NoSuchMethodError when I'm trying to use setter

field.name: description
field.value: I have an exception:{code}Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: mult_constructors_3_bug.Identifier.setMyNullable(Z)V at mult_constructors_3_bug.Identifier$$ClassObj.init(multiply_constructors_3_bug.kt:9) at mult_constructors_3_bug.namespace.main(multiply_constructors_3_bug.kt:16) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:12{code}when I'm trying to run this code:{code}namespace mult_constructors_3_bugpublic open class Identifier() { private var myNullable : Boolean = true class object { open public fun init(isNullable : Boolean) : Identifier { val __ = Identifier() __.myNullable = isNullable return __ } }}fun main(args: Array<String>) { var i1 : Identifier? = Identifier.init(true)}{code}

field.name: description
field.value: {code}namespace while_bug_1import java.io.*open class AllEvenNum() { class object { open public fun main(args : Array<String?>?) : Unit { var i : Int = 1 while ((i <= 100)) { { if (((i % 2) == 0)) { System.out?.print((i.toString() + ",")) } } (i++) } } }}public open fun main(args : Array<String>) { AllEvenNum.main(Array<String?>(0))}{code}Exception in thread "main" java.lang.VerifyError: (class: while_bug_1/AllEvenNum$1$1, method: invoke signature: ()V) Expecting to find object/array on stack at while_bug_1.AllEvenNum$1.main(verify_bug.kt:10) at while_bug_1.namespace.main(verify_bug.kt:31) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:120)

field.name: summary
field.value: "Optimize imports" may change the resolve by hiding an explicit 'invoke' import

field.name: description
field.value: a.kt``package bug.aclass A(val foo: MyFunction)class MyFunctionoperator fun MyFunction.invoke() = println("invoke convention")fun baz1() = 1fun baz2() = 2fun baz3() = 2``b.kt``package bug.bimport bug.a.*import bug.a.invokefun A.foo() = println("extension function")fun main(args: Array<String>) { baz1() + baz2() + baz3() // to leave "import bug.a.*" untouched val a = A(MyFunction()) a.foo()}``Now `foo` is resolved to the invocation of property and invoke (`invoke convention` is printed)."Optimize imports" action removes the line `import.a.invoke` (which is wrong), and the call starts to resolve to the extension function (`extension function` is printed).

field.name: summary
field.value: Strange 'unresolved' bug when using constructor parameters that aren't properties

field.name: description
field.value: {code}class A(w: Int, val u: Int) { var a = w //ok var b = 1 //ok { b += w //ok } var c = w //error: 'w' is unresolved { c += w //error: '+=' is unresolved } var d = u //when 'u' is val, everything is ok { d += u //ok }}{code}

field.name: description
field.value: {code}class A() { val c = 1 val a = b // error: Variable 'b' must be initialized val b = $c // '$c' is unresolved !!!}class B() { val c = 1 val b = $c // '$c' is resolved}{code}

comment.author: Andrey.Breslav
stepan.koltsov
comment.text: Andrey, there is no problem in your last example.

field.name: description
field.value: namespace foofun main(args : Array<String>) { System.out?.println(3.compareTo(2))}On run I get:Exception in thread "main" java.lang.VerifyError: (class: foo/namespace, method: main signature: ([Ljava/lang/String;)V) Stack size too large at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:169) at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:113)

field.name: summary
field.value: looks like a bug in Nullability detection

field.name: description
field.value: {code} fun repro(iNullable: Int?) : Int { var i = iNullable if (i == null) return 0 if(i.hashCode() == 0) return 1 return i }{code}

comment.author: svtk
comment.text: Variable 'i' should be immutable ('''val''' i) to be casted. Local mutable variables could be casted but it's not supported yet (see KT-3175).

comment.author: coox
comment.text: It's been checked for null already. Since it's a local variable it cannot be changed unexpectedly

field.name: description
field.value: {code:lang=kotlin}$ cat src/main/kotlin/bug/A.kt package bugclass A { internal val field = "foo"}$ kotlinc -module-name bug -d classes src/main/kotlin/bug/A.ktinfo: PERF: INIT: Compiler initialized in 349 msinfo: PERF: ANALYZE: 1 files (6 lines) in 330 msinfo: PERF: GENERATE: 1 files (6 lines) in 47 ms$ cat src/test/kotlin/bug/ATest.ktpackage bugclass ATest { val a = A().field}$ kotlinc -classpath classes -module-name bug -d classes src/test/kotlin/bug/ATest.ktsrc/test/kotlin/bug/ATest.kt:4:14: error: cannot access 'field': it is 'internal' in 'A' val a = A().field{code}Note: same problem if I compile `A.kt` into a jar file (and I verified it contains `META-INF/bug.kotlin_module`)

comment.author: udalov
comment.text: This is expected behavior. You cannot bypass internal visibility check by merely providing the same module name as what your library (classes you're compiling against) uses.

comment.author: aaron.sarazan_BqDX
comment.text:
It's interesting that when you compile unit tests using IDEA's build system, there is no problem accessing internal vals. Is this IDEA being noncompliant or is it a feature deficit in kotlinc?
For the record it would be really fantastic to be able to use internal from unit tests, so I'm hoping for the latter.

comment.author: udalov
comment.text: Kotlin plugin in IDEA does not invoke `kotlinc` directly on Make; it loads and launches the compiler jar, manually supplying different custom options which are not available via the `kotlinc` command line interface: module structure, incremental caches location, etc.

comment.author: aaron.sarazan_BqDX
comment.text:
Are there plans to make those custom options available to kotlinc? It's troubling how vastly different the outcome of my tests are based solely on how I choose to execute them. Makes the 'spec' seem kind of useless.
Let me know if this should be a separate bug and I'll file it.

comment.author: udalov
comment.text:
Yes, there are such plans.
> It's troubling how vastly different the outcome of my tests are based solely on how I choose to execute them.
Perhaps you mean how you choose to compile them, not execute?

comment.author: cedricbeust
comment.text:
Sorry for the late reply, I didn't get any email about the activity.
I'm a bit perplexed, what's the point of `-module-name` then?

comment.author: udalov
comment.text: Currently there's no value in `-module-name` for an end user, I don't think we even advertised it anywhere. In the future providing the module name would be required, for instance, to use reflection on package-level members.

field.name: summary
field.value: Wrong diagnostic about "weaken access privilege" when inherit Java class from Kotlin class

field.name: description
field.value: Kotlin```kotlinpackage bugtrait A { protected val foo: String protected fun bar()}open class AImpl : A { override val foo: String = "?" override fun bar() {}}```Java:```javapackage bug;public class JavaClass extends AImpl {}```

comment.author: udalov
comment.text: No longer relevant since non-public members are not allowed in interfaces.

field.name: summary
field.value: Strange resolution bug when data class copy is called in the initializer of a property named "copy"

field.name: description
field.value: {code}data class A(val x: Int)val copy = A(42).copy(){code}{code}ERROR: 1.kt: (3, 18) Variable 'copy' must be initialized{code}Apparently `copy()` was resolved to the property, not to the synthesized function in `A`.Changing the property name makes the error go away

field.name: description
field.value: Earlier name of these functions was `contains` but it changed, for more information see:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1069063#c29https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1102219Note: we already have shim for String.prototype.contains

field.name: summary
field.value: Wrong result when use break in if condition

field.name: description
field.value: (description is updated, initial issue stated that there is bug in IDE, not in back-end)The code below terminates and prints nothing:```fun main(args: Array<String>) { while (true) { if (true || break) { println("a") } }}```But || operator is lazy. So this behavior is wrong. Program must work infinitely and print 'a'.

comment.author: Zalim.Bashorov
comment.text: Actually it's bug in JVM backend

comment.author: Zalim.Bashorov

field.name: description
field.value: Code```fun main(args: Array<String>) { async {Q.qwe()}}object Q { suspend fun qwe() { fun f() = console.log("fffffffffffffffff") val g = ::f g() asd() // If this line is commented out, it works } suspend fun asd() {}}```Output:```Uncaught (in promise) ReferenceError: f is not defined at Coroutine$qwe.local$g (shared-utils.kt:289) at Coroutine$qwe.doResume (kotlin-bugs.kt:14) at Q.qwe (kotlin-bugs.kt:11)```

field.name: summary
field.value: Type substitution bug related platform types

field.name: description
field.value: ```// A.javapublic class A { public static <T> T id(T t) { return t; } @NotNull static List<String> bar() { return Collections.emptyList(); }}// k.ktfun test() { val id = A.id(A.bar()) // wrong type: `(Mutable)List<String!>` instead of `(Mutable)List<String!>!` val id1 = A.id(4) // correct type: Int!}```see LazyJavaTypeResolver.FlexibleJavaClassifierTypeCapabilities.Impl.substitutionResult

field.name: description
field.value: When applying android extension through project build.gradle, the kotlinx import and views cannot be resolved. It gives compile-time error, but everything works fine.allprojects{// modules that need android extensionsdef androidExtensions = [ "exercisemodule", "monkeymodule", ]if(androidExtensions.contains(it.name)){ apply plugin: 'kotlin-android-extensions' }}. Everything works fine, i can apply other modules like kotlin-android, kotlin-kapt, etc

comment.text: Is the error displayed only in the IDE?

field.name: summary
field.value: Android non-ASCII TextView Id Unresolved Reference Bug

field.name: description
field.value: For example, {code:lang=xml|title=layout.xml}<TextView android:id="@+id/sonu" . . . />{code}{code:lang=kotlin|title=activity.kt}sonu.text = "Hello World"{code} I'm get an error, Unresolved reference:sonu-----------------------------But this code worked fine!{code:lang=kotlin|title=activity.kt}var sonu : TextView = findViewById(R.id.sonu)sonu.text = "Hello World"{code}sonu have a non-ASCII character, ->Turkish characterAndroid Studio 3.0 preview version in Mac Os Sierra 10.12.6

field.name: summary
field.value: JS: Kotlin.charArrayOf is suboptimal due to Rhino bugs

field.name: description
field.value: Current implementation of `Kotlin.charArrayOf` requires additional `slice` call due to a Rhino bug (see https://github.com/mozilla/rhino/pull/297)Instead of ```withType("CharArray", js("new Uint16Array([].slice.call(arguments))"))```it could be ```withType("CharArray", js("new Uint16Array(arguments)"))```
